DataElement.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Four Meter Have Completed Walking Test Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response of whether they have completed the four meter walking test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Four Meter Have Completed Walking Test Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0)._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._A unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). A meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards._A question about whether an individual has completed a walking test._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Concepts.definition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Property.preferredName: Four Meter Have Completed Walking Test Indicator

A meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.:A question about whether an individual has completed a walking test.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

A unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). A meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.
A question about whether an individual has completed a walking test.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
